/**
 * @author gmendel
 *
 * To change this generated comment go to 
 * Window>Preferences>Java>Code Generation>Code and Comments
 */
public class Empty {
	



	private org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell sShell = null;  //  @jve:visual-info 
decl-index=0 visual-constraint="23,16"
	private org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite composite = null;
	private org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite composite1 = null;
	private org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Button button = null;
	/**
	 * This method initializes sShell	
	 *
	 */    
	private void createSShell () {
		sShell = new org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell ();		   
		composite1 = new
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite(sShell,org.eclipse.swt.SWT.NONE);
		composite = new
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite(sShell,org.eclipse.swt.SWT.NONE);
		button = new org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Button(composite,org.eclipse.swt.SWT.NONE);
		sShell.setSize(new org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Point(315,159));
		composite1.setBounds(new org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Rectangle(145,19,130,70));
		composite.setBounds(new org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Rectangle(13,17,110,73));
	
composite.setBackground(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.getDefault().getSystemColor(org.eclipse.swt.SWT.COLOR_RED));
		button.setBounds(new org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Rectangle(18,17,44,25));
		button.setText("Ok");
	}
 }

This issue was caused by launching the same property editor twice without
changing the selection.  It was attempting to reuse the existing editor, but the
creation of the control wasn't checking to see if the control had been disposed.
 Fixed the property editors to re-initialize the control if the widget is disposed.

Also fixed an issue with the OK button on the property editor dialog not
unregistering its PropertyChangeListener from the chooser when its disposed.

Released:
ColorPropertyEditor
FontPropertyEditor
CursorPropertyEditor
PropertyDialogEditor
M1 released, move all resolved to Verified, as prelude to closing.
M1 released, move all resolved/verified to Closed.
